Text.Value: Follow me.
This is the House of Grief; we strive to help those whose hearts have grown heavy, be it with anger, melancholy, grief...
Do I know you?
All in due time.
I need to see the Mother Superior.
Then just trust me a little longer - this is almost over.
Well...
They're my people - I know them even if I don't remember them. You trust me, don't you?
This is a place of healing. Anyone who partook in our methods did so willingly, and left with a smile on their face, freed from their troubles.
Let us through. You know I'm expected.
Spare me your venom - I'm sure the Mother Superior will have plenty of her own.
Really? After everything we've been through? Sit on your misgivings for now - this is nearly over.
Perhaps, perhaps not - that depends on you. Lady Shar may honour you, but your memories are a privilege. We will see if you have truly earned them - in due time.
Say nothing.
Let us pass.
I've come too far to turn back now. Just a little longer - we're near the end of this, one way or another.
Welcome back - we've been awaiting you, Shadowheart.
Of course.
Submit to the Mapping, and reveal what lurks in your heart. If you consent, follow me. If you do not, leave.
You haven't changed one bit, have you? I hope you remember it all, in the end. I want you to know how much of a failure you truly are.
There's been some debate whether you'd even show up and face the consequences of your actions. I assumed you'd try to flee, like a craven.
As I said - in due time. First you submit to the Mapping of the Heart - only then can we know what is to be done with you.
It will come. All in due time.
I'll take your silence to mean utmost trust and respect then. Just follow my lead.
...or ambitions beyond their station.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Glance at Shadowheart with some suspicion

Text.Value: Would you accuse a surgeon of robbing a tumour? I think not.
So the rumours are true then... the Dark Lady has blessed you. Most curious.
I don't like this - we should leave, Shadowheart.
The Mapping of the what?
Welcome to the House of Grief... or perhaps 'welcome' is the wrong word, Shadowheart.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Fixes Shadowheart with a cold stare after 'house of grief'

Text.Value: ...or treachery.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Glance at Shadowheart with some suspicion

Text.Value: Remain silent.
Do I know you? I like to be on a first-name basis before I give someone a thrashing, ideally.

EditorData.NodeContext: Incensed at an apparent stranger insulting her.

Text.Value: I met a man who'd been robbed of his memories - your handiwork?

Synopsis: Attendant serving as the front desk for the House of Grief. Recognises Shadowheart and urges her to enter the room beyond and submit to the Mapping of the heart, and beyond it, her return to the Sharran grotto.
